subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacity to deliver improved justice and security, including safeguarding citizen security, in conflict-affected settings
subproject.description: The Creating Livelihood Opportunities for High Risk Youth (CLOHRY) project is UNDP and government of Liberia initiative targeting retrenched plantation workers, including youth, and communities, whose livelihoods are being affected by the ongoing repossession and reorganization in Guthrie Rubber Plantation in Bomi and Grand Cape Mount Counties, following the concession agreement between the Government of Liberia and Malaysian company, Sime Darby. The current effort is to provide safety-net as well as medium to long term measures that will offer livelihood opportunities for men and women through a number of interventions preceded by a comprehensive needs assessment; leadership and peace building training; Agricultural and vocational skills training and community-based micro enterprise development
subproject.title: Creating Livelihood Opportunit

title: Creating Livelihood Opportunities for Workers in Guthrie
